nodes.bodyText: Create a ticket to do this more efficiently by passing all of the relevant job ids.
Seems like these are duplicate lines.
This will be handled in the "search" changes.

By the name of this I thought this was the validation result of the jobs.  Can we make a slight change to make it clear this is to be used with a request.
For example: JobsIdsValidationRequestModel
isn't 10 a little low? I feel we should be able to get at least 100 items a page rather quickly
The client of the API can override this, but 10 is the default for audit entries and Black Duck API pages, so I was trying to key off of that.
Should we be using the jetbrains nullable?
Good catch. This change was made before that decision.
Are these TODOs? If so, we should add that. If they are meant to be empty for now, you should be able to put an empty function directly into wherever they are used.
They are being addressed by a separate ticket, so I wanted to leave them for ease of implementation.
Are these for the next major version? Since people are using our API, won't this break things for them?
We have swagger documentation of endpoints, but we make it explicitly clear that these endpoints are not considered stable.
